llm.feedback:
Up | 3–6 months | Gradual policy easing as inflation nears target and wage growth remains steady, which compresses risk premia and tilts leadership toward productivity-rich sectors such as AI and semiconductors | Jackson Hole communications and incoming wage/inflation data confirming cooling dynamics | Probability 60% (37UZC9X8I)(H7Q52FKDH)

Up | 3–6 months | The onshore semis/AI capex regime (Regime C) gains prominence as Chips Act policy frameworks, onshore supply resilience, and earnings cycles align, driving AI compute capacity and semiconductor-margin expansions higher | Concrete progress on Chips Act stake and funding, Intel‑related capex announcements, and the degree to which domestic supply chains support higher onshore profitability, with potential upside for AI compute players and equipment firms | Probability 50% (37UZC9X8I)(H7Q52FKDH)

Down | 3–6 months | If wage momentum proves stickier and policy communications tilt back toward restraint, the regime would re‑inflate risk premia, widen credit spreads, depress cyclicals, and shift leadership back toward defensives or cash flows, undermining the AI/semis capex lift and diminishing the productivity‑driven earnings power | Jackson Hole's articulation on inflation persistence, fresh wage data, and the timing/pace of any policy tightening signals | Probability 40% (37UZC9X8I)

Down | 0–3 weeks | Bethel's Vessel 75‑unit project under 8‑30g carries local zoning risk, a denial or delayed override would curb the affordable housing impulse in a high‑price market and could trigger a repricing in related private‑capital flows, dampening near‑term risk appetite for housing and associated urban development plays | Plan vote outcomes, any 8‑30g litigation developments, and the potential for scaled‑back approvals that maintain the impulse but push timelines | Probability 45% (F8GF45MEU)
